button._tooltip: Selects 𝅝 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Selects 𝅗𝅥 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Selects 𝅘𝅥 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Selects 𝅘𝅥𝅮 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Selects 𝅘𝅥𝅯 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Selects 𝅘𝅥𝅱 as the duration for inserting notes or rests
Alternates inserting start triplet and end triplet markers
Choose any sort of clef. If the cursor is at the start change initial clef, else insert chosen clef.
Insert/Edit a key change at the cursor position
Edit/Insert a time signature change for the current measure
Add a note to the current chord The cursor position determines which note to add
Begin Slur from note/chord at cursor, or remove a Begin Slur
End Slur at note/chord at cursor, or remove an End Slur
Tie from the note/chord at the cursor - will be ignored if next note is not at the same pitch
Alternates inserting start triplet and end triplet markers
Insert a tempo change at cursor
Insert a Dynamic Marking at the cursor
Start Crescrendo from note/chord at cursor
End Crescendo on note/chord at cursor
Start Diminuendo from note/chord at cursor
End Diminuendo from note/chord at cursor
Adds/Removes a trill to the note
Choose more palettes of buttons.
Insert a Dynamic Marking at the cursor
Start Crescrendo from note/chord at cursor
End Crescendo on note/chord at cursor
Start Diminuendo from note/chord at cursor
End Diminuendo from note/chord at cursor
Prints a Sustain Pedal On Mark
Adds two staff braced together for keyboard instrument.
Adds a staff to be used purely for dynamic markings, insert after right hand piano staff
Prints a Sustain Off Mark
(Print) the current voice moves to the staff you name.
Inserts an 8va mark (transposing the notes accordingly) or terminates one already started.

When appending, appends a 𝅝 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅝 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.

When appending, appends a 𝅗𝅥 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅗𝅥 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.

When appending, appends a 𝅘𝅥 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅘𝅥 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.

When appending, appends a 𝅘𝅥𝅮 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅘𝅥𝅮 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.

When appending, appends a 𝅘𝅥𝅯 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅘𝅥𝅯 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.

When appending, appends a 𝅘𝅥𝅰 With the cursor on a note inserts a 𝅘𝅥𝅰 before the current note If MIDI-in is active, the note will be pitchless (displays yellow, percussion-sounding) - the MIDI keyboard will provide the pitch. Changes prevailing duration.
Insert 𝄻 rest
Insert 𝄼 rest
Insert 𝄽 rest
Insert 𝄾 rest
Insert 𝄿 rest
Insert 𝅀 rest
Dot, double dot or undot the note at the cursor
Change the current note to a 𝅝
Change the current note to a 𝅗𝅥
Change the current note to a 𝅘𝅥
Change the current note to a 𝅘𝅥𝅮
Change the current note to a 𝅘𝅥𝅯
Change the current note to a 𝅘𝅥𝅰
Dot, double dot or undot the note at the cursor
Halves the duration of the note/chord/rest at the cursor or the selection. E.g. Quarter Note becomes Eighth Note.
Doubles the duration of the note/chord/rest at the cursor or the selection. E.g. Quarter Note becomes Half Note.
Changes the note the cursor is on to the note A. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.
Changes the note the cursor is on to the note B. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.
Changes the note the cursor is on to the note C. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.
Changes the note the cursor is on to the note D. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.
Changes the note the cursor is on to the note E. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.
Changes the note the cursor is on to the note F. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.
Changes the note the cursor is on to the note G. If the cursor is in the appending position, appends a note using the prevailing duration.
Changes the note at the cursor to an octave higher
Changes the note at the cursor to an octave lower
Forces the accidental on the note to be printed.
Prints the accidental in ().
Sharpen the note at the cursor or next entered note if the cursor is in the appending position
Flatten the note at the cursor or next entered note if the cursor is in the appending position
Adds/Removes a trill to the note
Adds/Removes a Mordent to the note
Adds/Removes a prall to the note
Adds/Removes Up Prall ornament
Add/Removes a Turn to the note
Add/Removes a Reverse Turn to the note
Mark/Unmark current selection or note with UpBow
Mark/Unmark selection or current object
Mark/Unmark current selection or object with a harmonic
Mark/Unmark the selected notes arpeggio
Marks/Unmaks the selection with the Portato
Mark/Unmark the selected notes stopped
Inserts fingering for open string
Inserts fingering for finger 1
Inserts fingering for finger 2
Inserts fingering for finger 3
Inserts fingering for finger 4
Inserts fingering for finger 5
The given number as right hand fingering, using the conventional p,m,i indicators. Use Cancel to delete
Adds a voice to the current staff, initially displayed on a staff of its own, for readability. It will print on the staff above, and can be displayed there using Join Voices command if desired.
The two voices will be printed only once when they are the same, otherwise they will be printed as parts. (Off/On)
(Print) Merges rests where two voices have a common rest. Not for whole measure or multi-measure rests.
Turns off horizontal displacement of notes (which avoid collisions between parts)
Turns on horizontal displacements of notes where needed.
On printing the current note/chord will be shifted from notes in other voices by the amount you give. Use with Voice Presets to ensure this chord is in a different voice.

Select a voice for the music following the cursor position. The Voice 1,2,3,4 choices set up the voices so that first and third voices get stems up, second and fourth voices get stems down, third and fourth voice note heads are horizontally shifted, and rests in the respective voices are automatically moved to avoid collisions. The Automatic Voice setting returns all the voice settings to the neutral default directions
Mark/Unmark current selection or object with a fermata
Adds the staccato dot or removes it
Toggles Staccatissimo
Toggles the Tenuto Line _ On/Off
Adds the > accent
Mark/Unmark the selected notes marcato
Insert a barline indicating the start of a repeated section.
Insert a barline indicating the end of a repeated section.
Inserts a barline ending one repeated section and starting another
Insert a double barline at cursor position.
Inserts a closing barline (a double bar with last one thicker).
Skips the printing of any automatic barline here - allows line break.
(Print) start a first time bar, must be followed by EndVolta.
(Print) start a second time bar, must be followed by EndVolta
Ends a volta, that is a n'th time bar
Inserts first and second time bars each with a whole measure rest. You can then edit this to suit your music, e.g by inserting extra bars, deleting the repeat start etc.
Instructs the LilyPond engraver to start a beam here. (Print effect only)
Instructs LilyPond engraver to stop previously started manual beaming. Print effect only.
Typeset the note at the cursor with no beam to the right.
Typeset the note at the cursor with no beam to the left.
Prints with just one beam linking to the right.
Prints with just one beam linking to left.
Prints with just two beams linking to the right.
Prints with just two beams linking to the left.
Prints with just three beams linking to the right.
Prints with just three beams linking to the left.
